detaileddescription.para: A monotonically increasing unique ID for each track created
The track's start point
The track's end point
The azimuthal angle for the track
The azimuthal angle index into the global 2D ragged array of tracks
A dynamically sized vector of segments making up this track
The track which reflects out of this track along its "forward" direction for reflective boundary conditions.
The track which reflects out of this track along its "reverse" direction for reflective boundary conditions.
The first index into the global 2D ragged array of tracks for the track that reflects out of this track along its "forward" direction for reflective boundary conditions.
The second index into the global 2D ragged array of tracks for the track that reflects out of this track along its "forward" direction for reflective boundary conditions.
The first index into the global 2D ragged array of tracks for the track that reflects out of this track along its "reverse" direction for reflective boundary conditions.
The second index into the global 2D ragged array of tracks for the track that reflects out of this track along its "reverse" direction for reflective boundary conditions

A boolean to indicate whether to give the flux to the "forward" (false) or "reverse" (true) direction of the track reflecting out of this one along its "forward" direction for reflective boundary conditions.

A boolean to indicate whether to give the flux to the "forward" (false) or "reverse" (true) direction of the track reflecting out of this one along its "forward" direction for reflective boundary conditions.
A boolean to indicate whether the outgoing angular flux along this track's "forward" direction should be zeroed out for vacuum boundary conditions.
A boolean to indicate whether the outgoing angular flux along this track's "reverse" direction should be zeroed out for vacuum boundary conditions.

briefdescription.para: Destructor clears the track segments container.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double start_x, const double start_y, const double end_x, const double end_y, const double phi)
memberdef.name: setValues

briefdescription.para: Set the values for the track's start and end point and angle.

parameterdescription.para: the x-coordinate at the starting point
the y-coordinate at the starting point
the x-coordinate at the ending point
the y-coordinate at the ending point

briefdescription.para: Initializes a track's unique ID.

detaileddescription.para:
This is set by the trackgenerator to correspond to the track's location in a 2D ragged array of all tracks.
uid
the track's unique ID

briefdescription.para: Set the track's azimuthal angle.
Set the index for the track's azimuthal angle index.

detaileddescription.para:
The azimuthal angle index corresponds to a an array of all azimuthal angles for $ \theta \in [0, \pi] $ owned by the TrackGenerator class.
index
the azimuthal angle index

briefdescription.para: Sets the direction in which the flux leaving this track along its "forward" direction is passed to reflective track for boundary conditions.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets whether or not to pass the outgoing flux from this track along its "forward" direction to the "forward" direction (false) or "reverse" direction (true) of the track reflecting out of this one at the boundary. This is used for reflective boundary conditions.
refl_in
the "forward" (false) or "reverse (true) direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the direction in which the flux leaving this track along its "reverse" direction is passed to reflective track for boundary conditions.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets whether or not to pass the outgoing flux from this track along its "reverse" direction to the "forward" direction (false) or "reverse" direction (true) of the track reflecting out of this one at the boundary. This is used for reflective boundary conditions.
refl_out
"forward" (false) or "reverse (true) direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the boundary condition for the incoming flux along the track's "forward" direction.

detaileddescription.para:
The boolean represents vacuum (false) or reflective (true) boundary conditions.
bc_in
boundary condition for the incoming flux in the "forward" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the boundary condition for the incoming flux along the track's "reverse" direction.

detaileddescription.para:
The boolean represents vacuum (false) or reflective (true) boundary conditions.
bc_out
boundary condition for the incoming flux in the "reverse" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the track reflecting into this track's "forward" direction.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the track reflecting into the "forward" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the track reflecting into this track's "reverse" direction.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the track reflecting into the "reverse" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the first index of the track reflecting into this track's "forward" direction in the 2D jagged array of tracks.

parameterdescription.para: the first index of the incoming track along the "forward" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the second index of the track reflecting into this track's "forward" direction in the 2D jagged array of tracks.

parameterdescription.para: the second index of the incoming track along the "forward" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the first index of the track reflecting into this track's "reverse" direction in the 2D jagged array of tracks.

parameterdescription.para: the first index of the incoming track along the "reverse" direction

briefdescription.para: Sets the second index of the track reflecting into this track's "reverse" direction in the 2D jagged array of tracks.

parameterdescription.para: the second index of the incoming track along the "reverse" direction

briefdescription.para: Return the track's unique ID.
Returns a pointer to the track's end point.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the track's end point

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the track's start point.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the track's start point

briefdescription.para: Return the track's azimuthal angle (with respect to the x-axis).
Return the index for the track's azimuthal angle (with respect to the x-axis).
Returns a pointer to a segment with a given index.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a pointer to the segment or ends program if track does not have the requested segment.
segment
index into the track's segments container
a pointer to the requested segment

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of pointers to the track's segments.
Return the number of segments along this track.
Returns the incoming track.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the incoming track

briefdescription.para: Returns the outgoing track.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the outgoing track

briefdescription.para: Returns the first index of the track reflecting out of this one along its "forward" direction in the 2D jagged array of all tracks.

simplesect.para: the first index of the reflecting track

briefdescription.para: Returns the second index of the track reflecting out of this one along its "forward" direction in the 2D jagged array of all tracks.

simplesect.para: the second index of the reflecting track

briefdescription.para: Returns the first index of the track reflecting out of this one along its "reverse" direction in the 2D jagged array of all tracks.

simplesect.para: the first index of the reflecting track

briefdescription.para: Returns the second index of the track reflecting out of this one along its "reverse" direction in the 2D jagged array of all tracks.

simplesect.para: the second index of the reflecting track

briefdescription.para: Returns whether to give the outgoing flux to the "forward" (false) or "reverse" (true) direction of the track reflecting out of this one along its "forward" direction.
Returns whether to give the outgoing flux to the "forward" (false) or "reverse" (true) direction of the track reflecting out of this one along its "reverse" direction.
Returns the boundary condition for the flux along the track's "forward" direction.

simplesect.para: vacuum (false) or reflective (true) reflective boundary conditions

briefdescription.para: Returns the boundary condition for the flux along the track's "reverse" direction.

simplesect.para: vacuum (false) or reflective (true) reflective boundary conditions

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a point is contained along this track.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the point of interest

simplesect.para: true if the point is on the track, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Adds a segment pointer to this track's list of segments.

detaileddescription.para:
This method assumes that segments are added in order of their starting location from the track's start point.
segment
a pointer to the segment

briefdescription.para: Deletes each of this track's segments.
Convert this track's attributes to a character array.

detaileddescription.para:
The character array returned includes the track's starting and ending coordinates, the azimuthal angle and azimuthal weight.
a character array of this track's attributes

briefdescription.para: A track represents a characteristic line across the geometry.

detaileddescription.para: A track has particular starting and ending points on the boundaries of the geometry and an azimuthal angle.
